discussion.p: and tuple<int, int> t, then tuple-for-each([](int) { return Evil{}; }, t), the program will (unintentionally) abort.

blockquote.p: "NAD. This exposition-only facility is only used with things that return void. As far as I know, users can't define operator, for void. If I see the void cast, I don't need to audit the uses or be concerned that we'll add a broken use in the future."

resolution.p: This wording is relative to the forthcoming C++23 CD.
